titleStmt.title: A true relation of His Majesties coming to the town of Shrewsbury, on the 20 of this instant September, and his passage from thence the 23 day, to the city of Chester, with the manner of his entetainment [sic] there. Together with the L: Grandisons surprizing Nantwich, and the plundering of divers houses in the town and country thereabouts, of such as stood well-affected to the King and Parliament. Collected out of severall letters from men of good credit to their friends in London.
titleStmt.author: W. R.

notesStmt.note: Letter dated Nantwich, Septemb. 24, 1642 p. 5 signed W. R.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
